name: Merivale Manor

reviews.text: I enjoyed the Merivale Manor so much that I stayed an extra day at the end of my two-week trip.
reviews.title: Great Motel at Great Location
Terrific!
reviews.text: I arrived early at the beginning of my trip and my room was ready. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The on-sight owners were there to take care of any travel questions and had suggestions of their own.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the best location in Christchurch. You are within walking distance of the City Centre and even closer to the Merivale Mall. There are numerous restaurants and bars in the mall area.
reviews.title: Lovely rooms, but space a bit awkward
Good option for Christchurch
reviews.text: When I return to Christchurch, I will stay at the Merivale Manor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed staying at the Manor during our recent two week adventure in New Zealand. We stayed on two separate nights.
reviews.title: Great find

reviews.text: We arrived after a long 24hrs of travel from the states…it took a little while for the 6 of us to check it, as there was only one woman working the desk and she was handling a customer on the phone, but once she helped us, we were checked it with tomorrow's breakfast in hand and settling into our rooms.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the main house, which was superb. There is no elevator, so expect to lug your luggage up the stairs. Although cute and quaint on the outside, the rooms are updated and modern, with nice bathrooms and kitchenettes for cooking.
reviews.title: Super property and spacious and well decorated rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast consists of milk, cereal, bread, and condiments (butter, jam, etc). It was plenty to eat for us!
reviews.title: Just perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommend staying in the main house if possible. The rooms down near the road have one large window that faces the entry and parking area which don't offer much privacy unless you keep your blinds drawn. Otherwise, everyone can see you laying in bed!
reviews.title: Would love to stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again :)
reviews.title: Refreshing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This motel was nicer than a lot of hotels we have stayed in! The building is beautiful and the service is great (free breakfast, free wifi, free dvd's to borrow, plus help with any information you might need). The rooms are spacious and clean, and there is even a kitchenette. We went to Japanese restaurant a few doors down which was lovely!
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: Despite the terrible weather we had, this place made our stay in Christchurch bearable. Only bad thing I could say is that it is on a main road so a bit loud at night if you are in one of the front rooms.
reviews.title: Lovely little motel on the outskirts of Christchurch

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when we got to this motel. It was really clean and the rooms were stocked and modern. Great kitchen, huge bathroom and free wifi!!!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was great. So friendly and helpful. Being a small motel though no one is on staff after I believe it was 7pm which was tough for a pair of night owls. Still there were a couple of great places to shop and eat nearby. City center was within walking distance. Unfortunately when we went, Christchurch was still kind of a ghost town. Not much to do because the earthquake the year before decimated the city. Still a lot of rebuilding needed. The Merivale area is lovely though.
reviews.title: Just what we needed!

reviews.text: The only issue I had was the bed in the room. Whoever stayed there before had some bad BO and it lingered. That was the only issue with our stay. Febreeze is all that wouldve been needed to fix that situation. No big deal. Everything else was top notch.
reviews.title: Beautiful historic building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely return! Excellent, friendly service. Great value for money...and a few extras thrown in. From the moment you enter the Manor you are welcomed...you feel at home. Even though the Manor lies beside a busy road, my sleep was not interrupted. Thanks for having us!
reviews.title: Highly recommended stay

reviews.text: Arrived in a blistering 29 deg C Christchurch from a -2 deg C UK after 24hrs or so on planes.
reviews.title: Welcome relief after 24hrs on a plane.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank You - Merivale Manor for the quick, friendly and helpful check in.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The main building is well presented Victorian building with many of the original features intact. We secretly coverted their coving and picture rails.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was not large but was well appointed and perfectly good for two adults. The iPod / iPhone compatible stereo was particularly good as it mean't we didn't have fiddle around with chargers so early on in the trip - little things make the difference sometimes.
reviews.title: Lovely host, great location, spotless room

description: Welcome to Merivale Manor Motel Christchurch. Originally built in the 1880's, Merivale Manor has been transformed into 10 elegant, luxurious Studio, 1 and 2 bedroom apartments, as well as 8 Brand new Spa Studio units, all reasonably priced Christchurch accommodation, situated at 122 Papanui Road, Merivale, Christchurch, New Zealand.Merivale Manor Motel Christchurch is in a great location, less than 200 metres to central Merivale with its premier shopping, restaurants, cafes and bars. We are one of the closest Motels to St Georges Hospital, Nurse Maude Hospital & Hospice, St Andrews, Rangi Ruru, St Margaret's and Selwyn House schools. We are approximately 1.5 kilometres to Christchurch City centre. A short stroll to Christchurch's beautiful Hagley Park and Christchurch Casino. Merivale Manor is within easy access by car, taxi or bus to AMI Stadium, CBS Canterbury Arena (was Westpac Trust Centre), Railway Station, Christchurch's International and domestic Airport
